content: from your squares and block them if necessary all joins are made using yarn g the squares in this blanket are all joined with crochet stitches worked from the front the stitches are joined together using single_crochet stitches which are made into the front loops only refer to the layout diagram on page 14 to see how to arrange the squares ready for joining how to join squares © 2019 sandra paul 26 of 28 nature s walk blanket free www cherryheart co uk joining row work into each consecutive stitch or chain along the squares then make 1 chain before working the next two squares joining columns work into each consecutive stitch or chain to join the squares in the same way and make a slip_stitch into the 1ch between squares tip when joining squares together watch out where there are two or more chains along the edge the next chain tends to close up when the first is worked into so it s easy to miss edging set-up rounds once the squares have been joined two rounds of crochet are worked around the outside of the squares creating an edge to match the style of the joins and to prepare for the border join yarn g to any corner space then round 1 1ch 1sc 2ch 1sc in same chain space *work single_crochet sts along edge ad follows 1sc into each stitch or chain space 1sc into end of each join between squares to corner space 1sc 2ch 1sc in corner space repeat from * to beg of round slip_stitch into first single_crochet 956 sts 205 short sides/273 long sides - see stitch counts below round 2 slip_stitch in corner space 1sc 2ch 1sc in same space *1bpsc into each st to corner space 1sc 2ch 1sc in corner space repeat from * to beg of round slip_stitch into first single_crochet 964 sts 207 short sides/275 long sides do not break yarn this will be used to continue working the border stitch counts i have included a stitch count for these first two rounds as you will need the correct amount of stitches for the border pattern to work correctly however there will be an opportunity to make slight amendments a few stitches when working the next part to make counting easier here is a breakdown of the stitches for round 1 there will be 33 stitches along the edge of each square 1 stitch into each join and 1 chain in each corner short sides long sides 6 squares x 33 stitches = 198 8 squares x 33 stitches = 264 5 x stitches in joins 7 x stitches in joins 2 corner chains 2 corner chains total for each short side 205 total for each long side 273 border continuing in yarn g from edging set up rounds now round 1 slip_stitch in corner space 4ch counts as 1dc 1ch 2dc in same space *1dc into each st to corner space 2dc 2ch 2dc in corner
